meanings.definition: A hoisting device consisting of a block and tackle with a chain.
meanings.sent1: The workers used chainfalls to lift heavy equipment at the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The chainfalls were essential for raising the materials to the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The chainfalls decided to take a break after a long day of heavy lifting.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the steady pull of chainfalls, lifting her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The clinking sound of the chainfalls echoed through the warehouse.

meanings.definition: To lift or move with a chainfall.
meanings.sent1: They chainfalls the crates carefully to avoid any damage during transportation.
meanings.sent2: He chainfalls the engine into place with precision and expertise.
meanings.sent3: The magician chainfalls the rabbit out of the hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her words chainfalls his heart, lifting his mood instantly.
meanings.sent5: The crane operator chainfalls the container effortlessly onto the truck.
